instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message:
820-2936-B does not recognize the internal model of the screen 
I have it out for repair without PP15V_T29 after water damage.
I changed the U3890 and other small parts.
Now I have a problem with the screen resolution like on photo.

Can you help me with this problem?
Regards Mariusz

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message: PRAM reset? Is this the original LCD or was it changed?

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message:
PRAM done
display original and checked
If I run macos I can change resolution but original 1280x800 is missing.

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message: have you tried a different screen? that vertical bar is telling of lcd issue

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message: This could be corrupted EDID EEPROM in the LCD. First I would try another LCD assembly.

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message:
I checked another display without good results 
I will change lvds port to be sure

threads.title: [solved]820-2936-B does not recognize internal screen model and resolution
threads.message:
OK, problem solved
It was LVDS port.
I found nothing on it but with new one all works ok.
Thanks everyone for advice.
​Kindly Regards Mariusz
